Do you want the opportunity to leverage your skills to make a direct impact on the world’s leading life sciences and consumer products companies? Join Clarkston Consulting as a Data Scientist to help deliver creative business solutions to our market-leading clients as a part of our team of experienced professionals. We are looking for motivated, self-driven leaders who are energized by team results and interested in joining a firm that values its culture and people as its biggest strengths. Together, we can help find the answers to our clients most challenging business problems. What You’ll Do  Clarkston gives you the opportunity to deliver great solutions, become recognized as an industry expert, and help build a great practice. As a Data Scientist at Clarkston, you will: Conduct exploratory analysis, produce descriptive statistics and explain phenomena based on data  Develop statistical and machine learning models for POC and production-ready applications  Drive ideation and execution of experiments and in-market tests with an eye on accuracy and statistical significance  Provide coaching and mentorship to junior analysts who are developing their skills How You’ll Grow  At Clarkston, we feel that we provide the greatest value to our clients through a combination of our industry expertise, business process knowledge, and consulting excellence. Beyond your day-to-day responsibilities, throughout your career at Clarkston you will: Have the support and mentorship of your Clarkston colleagues and leaders Own your career – you'll be able to take charge of your career journey with diverse opportunities to lead and expand your skillset both at the client site and within the firm Have the opportunity to make a real and positive impact not only the clients you work with, but on the firm as well  Requirements What We’re Looking For: We are looking for versatile leaders and innovators with 3 years of relevant work experience in producing Machine Learning applications in production environments to work on diverse and challenging consulting projects to deliver true value to our clients. An ideal candidate as a Data Scientist would have gained experience in one or more of the following: Experience drawing insights from large data sets and manipulating data using a variety of methods and tools  Solid base understanding of statistical techniques around correlation, regression, outlier detection, and significance  Experience using a variety of machine learning techniques for supervised and unsupervised learning and their real-world advantages/drawbacks, including classification, regression, time series forecasting, clustering, and other use cases  Experience optimizing, testing, and documenting results of machine learning models  Knowledge of common machine learning pitfalls and how to avoid them, including normalization, feature selection, optimization, and validation  Experience querying databases and familiarity with SQL script languages  Knowledge of tasks relating to getting into a production environment and maintaining results: analyzing model drift, version control, security strategy, and monitoring and alerts  Understanding of the resource landscape with ability to research and form opinions around the best vendor solutions for our clients  Willingness to share technical solutions and product ideas with the team through design review, pair programming, code/model reviews, and tech talks  Minimum degree requirement: bachelor's degree (or MS/PhD) in Math, Statistics, Engineering or other relevant field for data science applications  Benefits Our benefits include: Comprehensive Health and Wellness Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, and more) 401k with company contributions Paid vacation, personal days, holidays, and sick leave Paid Parental Leave Life and Disability Insurance Company Equity or Stock Options Training and Professional Development investments Visit Careers at Clarkston to learn more about our culture, benefits, and opportunities. We hope you’ll join us! Travel Statement Travel is an integral part of this role and is estimated to average 30-50% and may vary based upon client and project needs. While travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19 restrictions, all non-essential travel has been limited and any on-site requests are subject to review. COVID-19 Vaccination Statement While Clarkston Consulting has not mandated vaccination at this time, COVID-19 vaccinations are required in order to access Clarkston Consulting facilities and those of many of our clients. With this in mind, all prospective hires will be required to provide their vaccination status.

We’re a family of health centers, supported by a family of Associates. For over 25 years, Health Choice Network (HCN) has been an employer of choice in South Florida, supporting health centers, patients, and the communities they serve. We are one of the first successful health center-controlled networks and our success is due largely to our Associates and their commitment to advancing our mission to improve the health status of our communities. Do you want to join an organization that believes in empowering their most precious resource, their Associates? Are you innovative and results driven? HCN is looking for talented, qualified individuals to join our rapidly expanding, first-class team. Position Summary This position is responsible for developing ongoing data specifications, running ongoing data needs, measurement analysis, monitoring and reporting of quality improvement initiatives. Position Responsibilities Serves as lead subject matter expert for all data needs for the Clinical Quality Department. Oversees successful validation and submission of all data requirements for clinical quality initiatives. Supports member health center service requests through Salesforce ticketing system by researching and providing solutions to data-related issues in Practice Analytics. Performs ongoing analysis of UDS, Meaningful Use, PCMH, HEDIS another clinical quality initiatives. Writes, develops, and publishes supplemental UDS reports to support health center reporting needs. Standardizes monitoring and trending of member center clinical quality performance metrics. Identifies areas of opportunity for network and member center performance improvement. Serves as lead subject matter expert in the mapping of clinical related data from HCN EMRs to data lakes. Works with internal and external stakeholders to ensure quality standards and data integrity is established and maintained amongst all HCN applications. Provides data build, specification write up, and reports for the following projects (but not limited to) NACHC Quality Improvement Projects Million Hearts Project ECHO FOCUS HRSA Other data-related cooperatives Manages departmental data request forms and backlog of data requests. Identifies areas of opportunity for network and member center performance improvement. Collaborates with internal teams on implementing optimal workflows and opportunities to improve performance and efficiency of systems. Actively consults on system upgrade testing and validation process. Serves as the network subject matter specialist on Practice Analytics, including application set up, end user training, report customization and support. Keeps abreast of technological system changes and innovations by maintaining a knowledge base consisting of release notes, system manuals & software enhancements. Performs ad hoc reports as needed. Other duties may be assigned. Skills, Abilities and Requirements Working proficiency in data management and reporting platforms. Ability to extract meaning and suggest action items from data, not just report metrics. Ability to articulate principles and concepts of data management and continuous quality improvement to technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to apply basic problem-solving skills. Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment. Education, Experience and Certifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum 3 years experience in healthcare with a demonstrated working knowledge of quality and data management. Expertise in research methodology, data analysis, database management and outcomes studies strongly preferred. Understanding of health care initiatives and health care data. Health Choice Network is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and complies with all federal and state laws, regulations and executive orders regarding affirmative action requirements in all programs. HCN is a drug-free workplace.

job_Description: Job Posting: UMA is a nonprofit healthcare educational institution with a national presence. Headquartered in Tampa, Florida and founded in 1994, UMA offers content-rich, interactive online programs as well as hands-on training at our Clearwater, Florida campus. Medical (including prescription), Dental, Vision (UMA subsidized) FSA/HSA (Depending on Medical Plan chosen) $50,000 Life Insurance (UMA paid) Additional Voluntary Life Insurance (Team Member paid) Employee Assistance Program – EAP (UMA paid) Long Term Disability (UMA paid) Short Term Disability (Team Member paid) Supplemental Insurance such as Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital (Team Member Paid) Paid Time Off – 15 days accrued in year 1, 9 holidays, and 1 day of Volunteering Time Off 401k (eligible upon completion of 90 days of employment and must be at least 21 years of age) Pet Insurance Identity Theft Protection Purpose of the Position: The Enterprise Data Architect, as a part of the Enterprise Architecture team, provides key leadership around how UMA defines, organizes, catalogs, moves, stores, accesses, and secures data. The Enterprise Data Architects serves as a data champion and will liaison with other key members of the Technology teams, and with business stakeholders to define and build UMA’s data architecture. In this hands-on role, the Enterprise Data Architect not only plans, but also executes and technically delivers. The Enterprise Data Architect reports to the Vice President, Enterprise Solutions and Architecture.  Key Responsibilities:  Functional: Works cross-functionally with IT and business stakeholders to communicate data vision and develop consensus and support for data strategy. Evangelizes the data vision. Becomes the data liaison between the data consumer representatives, Enterprise Data Management (EDM), Software Engineer, and Business Insights (BI)/Strategy teams for solution development, integration and governance as well as be able to serve as the lead data architect on major enterprise projects. Builds a framework for semantic and structural integrity and consistency of data across the UMA enterprise. Creates the standard for documenting development data requirements for enterprise projects. Provides consultation on complex projects and becomes the primary data subject matter expert (SME) for multiple applications or technologies. Ensures all data project and development efforts properly align to UMA's Enterprise Architecture and Vision, and Security Requirements. Drives project knowledge back to the enterprise data model and ensure that it evolves correctly. Utilizes the maturity to participate in multiple complex programs at the same time in an agile environment. Provides clear, continuous, and consistent data architecture leadership at a detailed level within assigned project. Practices continued personal development as the company's preeminent source of data information, focusing on new and evolving data and architectural concepts and frameworks, governance, and process. Attends conferences, lectures, online offerings, formal and informal training and identify executive certificate opportunities.in areas of focus that could include: ITIL, COBIT, SAFe, TOGAF, etc. Implements a set of process and procedures that ensure that all production level code goes through rigorous testing and proper stage gate processes before going live. Creates checklists that define the requirements must be adhered during the development life cycle. Ensures that all work is properly documented and that all stakeholders are informed of any changes made to the code, processes or data and their implications on future and previously reported data. Creates a consistent release cycle for new development projects, system maintenance, and bug fixes where and when possible. Provides process and procedures for daily monitoring and data validation to ensure consistency in the system and anticipate potential issues before they are reported by end users. Performs other duties as assigned. Technical: Modernizes and owns the data architecture and oversight of core data platform, to facilitate Master and Meta Data Management, Data Governance, Data Quality Management, Data Integration and Distribution, Data Security, and Reporting / Business Intelligence. Designs and builds strategy around cloud-first capabilities (Azure) and toolsets, accelerating innovation cycles and delivery times. Defines the vision, strategy and principles for enterprise data management across at UMA. Understands and aligns data capabilities across multiple 3rd party vendor enterprise platforms. (ERP, LMS, CRM, CDP, etc.). Builds the Enterprise Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD) Builds working proof of concepts (PoCs) to demonstrate capabilities and provide reference models to Software Engineering, BI/Strategy, and EDM teams. Defines the normalization and denormalization strategy for data across UMA. Understands and designs for Microsoft’s Dataverse platform as UMA’s universal Common Data Model. Defines publish/subscribe (Pub/Sub) vs Application Programming Interface (API) access use cases and strategy. Collaborates with Strategy teams on data science strategy for Machine Learning/ Artificial Intelligence (ML/AI) use cases at UMA. Designs, creates, and optimizes data assets across multiple business units for both tactical and strategic initiatives across UMA. Understands business drivers and works with Enterprise Architect (EA) team to develop of multi-year data roadmap that includes developing information management strategy, processes and tools, data technology opportunities, and data architecture and frameworks. Establishes and leads in the usage of world-class processes to achieve consistent results. Embeds Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) principles and delivery methodologies directly into UMA’s data architecture. In conjunction with business and key IT stakeholders, leads the definition of standards for naming, describing, governing, managing, modeling, cleansing, enriching, transforming, moving, storing, searching and delivering all data within the enterprise. Maintains a solid understanding of current and emerging tools and determine when to use them. Collaborates with other Architects on the evaluation of new tools, products, frameworks and technologies with the goal of ultimately providing direction and selection criteria that will be used to evaluate and select among other items an Enterprise Data Management Tool, Business Intelligence Tool, Storage Concepts, and Big Data Platform and Framework. Drives the customers' transformation to Modern Data Architecture and store technologies such as Database/Data Warehouse, NoSQL, and Hadoop. Business Leadership Champions UMA's enterprise data management strategy that will promote the growth of the organization capabilities, technical maturity, and the Enterprise Data Management team. Acts as SME for the data architecture, framework, development, tools and technologies, and design to assist the business/operations and IT with solutions. Develops a deep understanding of the current/future technical challenges of customers, and based on that understanding, formulates an aspirational data architecture and transformation roadmap. Coordinates with other Architects to provide technical leadership to drive data and technology choices, strategy, and implementation decisions to achieve high reliability and performance. Support Institutional Initiatives Manages, mentors, develops, and coaches all levels of the Enterprise Data Management Team. Responsible for creating, articulating, and enforcing UMA's overall Enterprise Data Management vision, architecture, and best practices and standards at multiple levels of the Enterprise Data Management Team. Provides data related mentoring and coaching for architects across the EDM Team. Keeps current on institutional goals, objectives, and progress. Engages in institutional sponsored activities and initiatives as appropriate. Leads with courage in support of change initiatives that impact organization. Manages and assists in coordinating efforts between departments within UMA. Compliance: Demonstrates knowledge of, and carefully follows all applicable federal and state compliance requirements and regulations including those prescribed by the Department of Education, accrediting agencies, CIE, and internal UMA policies and procedures. Effectively communicates compliance requirements to students and other staff as appropriate and quickly escalates any compliance concerns to the Compliance department. Work Experience, Skills & Abilities: Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or the equivalent combination of education and work experience. 10 years of diverse experience in designing and managing innovative data solutions beyond ETL and Warehousing. 10 years of experience implementing strategic, technical, architectural, and governance solutions related to Enterprise Data and Business Intelligence. Including: Business and IT Strategy Development, IT and DW Assessments, Project Planning, Estimating and Management, Executive Dashboard Reporting, Business Intelligence/Data Analytics, Data Warehousing, Data Modeling, Data Architecture Development, Database Design, Development and Administration, and Enterprise Data Management and Governance. 15 years of broad experience in the information technology to include business architecture, information architecture and strategy, IT strategic planning in a medium to large corporations. 15 years of experience in master data management, business intelligence and data warehousing. Broad knowledge of vendor capabilities in data management solutions – Master Data Management, Data Warehousing, Big Data, Data Quality, Business Intelligence etc. Experience working with Chief Security Officers to ensure security requirements are met and safeguards are firmly in place. These safeguards would be based on the results of a Data Security Assessment and would align with applicable regulatory requirements that could include Sarbanes-Oxley and Gramm-Leach-Bliley Acts. Able to professionally communicate in verbal and written English. Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other business tools such as Skype and Microsoft Teams. Technical Skills: Expert knowledge in Enterprise Data Management, Business Intelligence, and ETL Tools. Expert knowledge of Entity Relationship modeling, metadata systems, data quality tools and techniques. Current with data trends and opportunities that align with UMA's data objectives (e.g., Cloud, Big Data, Tools, etc.) Skilled at logical and physical data modeling, architecture, warehousing, strategy and query languages. Functional Skills: Expert knowledge in Data Architecture, Enterprise Data Management and Governance, Master Data Management, Data Warehousing and Business Analytics and Intelligence. Strong experience and a deep understanding of data usage and lifecycles across the corporate infrastructure. Proven experience in managing the complete SDLC from architecture to delivery. Deep understanding of various ETL, Data Management, and Business Intelligence tools is required. Broad knowledge of Big Data principles and tools that will enable data efforts beyond Relational Databases (e.g., JSON/XML, NoSQL, Hadoop, YARN, Azure SQL, AWS Aurora, etc.). Communication/Teamwork/Service Focus Excellent communication skills that enable the presenting of solid business cases, forming of partnerships, and framing of issues for a wide variety of stakeholders including executive management. Able to collaborate with relevant business and functional heads to ensure alignment with tactical and strategic goals. Able to deliver convincing and persuasive presentations to both technical and business teams. Able to build strong performing teams, that are capable of accomplishing objectives without supervision. Interpersonal skills to that allows for work with other data architects, other teams within IT, and functional heads of the business units. Strategy: Possess strong organizational, facilitation and critical thinking abilities, to assess complex problems, analyze options, navigate diverse perspectives and objectives and develop acceptable Enterprise application and governance solutions. Ability to understand and communicate the data requirements of any future infrastructure needs, working with the IT architects to develop an approach that fits the current and planned needs of the enterprise. Able to support a diverse and inclusive work environment. Preferred Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree or other Advanced Degree in Computer Science or related discipline. More than 10 years of diverse experience in designing and managing innovative data solutions beyond ETL and Warehousing. More than 10 years of experience implementing strategic, technical, architectural, and governance solutions related to Enterprise Data and Business Intelligence. Including: Business and IT Strategy Development, IT and DW Assessments, Project Planning, Estimating and Management, Executive Dashboard Reporting, Business Intelligence/Data Analytics, Data Warehousing, Data Modeling, Data Architecture Development, Database Design, Development and Administration, and Enterprise Data Management and Governance. More than 15 years of broad experience in the information technology to include business architecture, information architecture and strategy, IT strategic planning in a medium to large corporations. More than 15 years of experience in master data management, business intelligence and data warehousing. Working Environment: Ability to work full-remote, on-site, or a hybrid attendance model Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed. Physical Demands: Requires long periods of sitting at a desk working on a computer. Requires occasional bending, stooping and squatting Requires occasional lifting of up to 10 lbs.

Company Background Healthmap Solutions (Healthmap) is an NCQA-accredited industry leading kidney population health management company. Healthmap uses big data resources, integrated advanced technology, clinical expertise, and complex care management to improve the lives of people living with kidney disease. Healthmap also helps healthcare providers and payers achieve the value-based results they need. Our company is a diverse and growing organization committed to our clients, the patients we support, and our employees. We are champions for better health, for those who need us most. Responsibilities Compiling and organizing healthcare data Analyzing data to assist in developing optimal care management and decision making. Using healthcare data to assist in administrative and operational goals. Investigating data to find patterns and trends. Utilizing different data sources for analysis Develop reports and presentations. Communicating analytics insights to management Building Models and analyzing data to unearth trends and patterns. Delve into data to discover discrepancies and patterns. Suggest ways to both increase healthcare quality and lower costs. Collaborate with management and internal teams to implement and evaluate improvements. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Management information systems or other related focus. 5+ years of recent experience in the following: SQL Database queries (Exporting, Copying) 5+ years of recent experience in the following, Excel (Visualization, Pivot Tables, Summarizing) Database manipulation in SQL (Updates, Joins, Data types) Financial Analysis (Trending vs. Actual) Working with Project Managers and Technical Groups Proof of full Covid-19 Vaccination Preferred Prior large data experience Prior experience with healthcare data within health plan or vendor environments Familiarity with Health Plan financial data, PMPM, Per Thousand, Enrollment Operational Analysis Budget and Forecasting

Need to Have M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent Strong programming skills with working knowledge of Python You have 1-3 years of experience working on neural network based NLP Familiarity with the state of the art in deep learning Working knowledge of TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar frameworks Experience working in a Linux environment Team player with good communication skills (oral and written) Preferred Qualifications Ph.D. in Computer Science, Speech/Language Processing or Machine Learning Experience with MapReduce, Spark, or similar frameworks Experience building crawlers Experience administering Linux clusters Experience developing web applications Employee Benefits Stock. Be a [literal] stakeholder in our company’s future.   Food. Enjoy catered meals and boundless snacks. Fun. We host team lunches weekly and team events bi-quarterly. People. job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Artificial Intelligence Operations
job_Description: The Sr. Software Engineer (AI/ML Ops) is primarily responsible for building and scaling a machine learning operations system to power Cotiviti's AI/ML platforms. You'll have the opportunity to integrate machine learning libraries and operational frameworks into an end-to-end environment and work with AI/ML developers/data scientists to solve complex problems and create unique solutions. You'll also help to build a machine learning Operations pipeline to support development, experimentation, continuous integration, continuous delivery, verification/validation and monitoring of AI/ML models. We'd also like you to continuously evaluate the latest packages and frameworks while creating documentation and best practices to share with the AI/ML community. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and other MLOps Engineers to solve complex problems and create unique solutions for MLOps. Good understanding of machine learning fundamentals and familiarity with Machine Learning Development Lifecycle. Bring good knowledge on cloud/DevOps for Analytics Use Cases. Develop/Support end-to-end MLOps pipelines based on an in-depth understanding of cloud platforms, AI lifecycle, and business problems to ensure analytics solutions are delivered efficiently, predictably, and sustainably. Builds pipelines that shorten development cycles for our software and AI/ML systems: Build and automate our AI/ML workstream from data analysis, experimentation, operationalization, model training, model inference, model evaluation, and model tuning to visualization (includes versioning, compliance, and validation). Improve and maintain our automated CI/CD pipeline.  Execute best practices in version control and continuous integration/delivery.  Work well in a fast-paced cross-functional environment.  This individual would be working at the intersection of MLOps, Software Engineering and Data Science. Key Requirements:  At least 5 years of Industry experience with projects around Data Engineering or Data Warehousing.  At least 3 years of experience in Data Science / ML / AI and operationalization of models.  At least 3 years hands-on with Python. Strong Python programming experience, with demonstrated experience in package development, deploying software in a production setting, debugging.  At least 3 years hands-on experience with SQL/Spark SQL and can write complex queries with ease.  At least 3 years of experience in orchestrating ML Jobs on Oozie/Airflow/KubeFlow, Step Functions, etc.  At least 3 years of experience in implementing end-to-end machine learning life cycle on premise (Hadoop) or cloud (preferably in AWS).  At least 3 year of experience in Bigdata Technologies specifically on HDFS, Spark, and Hive.  At least 2 years of experience in a Production environment.  Strong in data/feature engineering and distributed processing with PySpark, etc.  Good understanding of AI engineering and MLOps concepts.  Demonstrable experience with ML Life-cycle management tools, data version and model version control and implementing MLOps.  Experience with Machine learning frameworks, libraries, and agile environments.  Experience in deploying machine learning solutions using DevOps principles.  Experience with version control tools such as Git, Bitbucket, etc.  Experience with SQL and relational databases.  Fluency with Programming and Scripting, such as Java, Python, Shell/Bash.  Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills. Desired Skills/Qualifications:  Experience in DataRobot platform for operating and monitoring models.  Experience in data visualization and exploration, familiarity with Tableau/Trino-Superset, AI services and app development is a plus.  Experience in AWS services Sagemaker, EC2, S3, EMR, Lambda Functions, Cloudwatch, etc.  Experience in one or more of Docker, Jenkins, Kubernetes (including distributions, Openshift), and other DevOps tools.  For the safety of our employees and those considering employment with Cotiviti, we are currently conducting all interviews virtually. In addition, the majority of the Cotiviti team is currently working remotely, and we are onboarding new hires remotely as well. As we monitor the pandemic, these arrangements may change and we will update accordingly. #LI-Remote Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

job_title: Data Science Manager - Core Search Engineering Capabilities
job_Description: Your Job Your Job: The Indeed Jobseeker Data Science team is at the center of people's professional life, personal growth and goals. Our team works on the ranking/personalization on our core search engine, recommendations shared with job seekers, metadata services, relevance measurement, and so much more. Our vision is to help every job seeker discover their next, most relevant job - and we help over 220M jobseekers every day. The role of Data Science at Indeed is to follow the data. We log, analyze, visualize, and model terabytes of job search data. Our Data Scientists build and implement machine learning models to make timely decisions. Each of us is a mixture of a statistician, scientist, machine learning expert, and engineer. We have a passion for building and improving Internet-scale products. We seek to understand human behavior via careful experimentation and analysis, to "help people get jobs". You understand that the best managers serve their teams by removing roadblocks and giving individual contributors autonomy and ownership. You have high standards and will take pride in Indeed like we do as well as push us to be better. You have delivered challenging technical solutions at scale. You have led Data Science or engineering teams, and earned the respect of talented practitioners. You are equally happy talking about deep learning and statistical inference, as you are brainstorming about practical experimental design and technology career development. You love being in the mix technically while providing leadership to your teams. Who You Are You're someone who wants to see the impact of your work making a difference every day. You understand how to use data to make decisions and how to coach others to do so. You find passion in the craft and are constantly seeking improvement and better ways to solve tough problems. You produce the highest quality Data Science solutions and lead others to do the same. You support a culture of diversity and inclusion, so that Indeed can deliver the most impactful, innovative work to help all job seekers get jobs. Significant prior success as a Data, Product, or Decision Science Manager working on challenging problems at scale. Strong ability to coach Data Scientists, helping them improve their skills and grow their careers Ph.D. or M.S. in Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics or equivalent field 5+ years of industry experience, with expertise in Data Science, Business Analytics, or Data Analysis. Strong ability to code in Python. Have full stack experience in data collection, aggregation, analysis, visualization, productionization, and monitoring. Passion to answer Product/Engineering questions with data We get excited about candidates who Can do small data modeling work: Python, R, Julia, Octave Can do big data modeling work: Hadoop, Pig, Scala, Spark Can fish for data: SQL, Pandas, MongoDB Can deploy Data Science solutions: Java, Python, C++ Can communicate concisely and persuasively with engineers and product managers Have experience hiring and onboarding a rapidly growing team Have experience in search ranking, deep learning, or recommendation systems Who we are We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time. Our Mission As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers. (*comScore Total Visits, March 2021) Salary Range Disclaimer The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits. Salary Range Transparency Austin 149,000 - 217,000 USD per year Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.  Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at  1-855-567-7767 , or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview. Our Policies and Benefits View Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobs Learn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/ Where legally permitted, Indeed requires all individuals attending or working out of Indeed offices or visiting Indeed clients to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. For positions that can only be performed at an Indeed office, candidates must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and present acceptable proof of vaccination by the date of hire as a condition of employment. For positions that require some in-office work or in-person client meetings, exceptions to these in-office or in-person job requirements may be made at the discretion of the business through June 2022, at which point full vaccination will be required. Indeed will consider requests for reasonable accommodation as required under applicable law. To qualify as being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 there should have been a two week period after receiving the second dose (or any government recommended booster shot) in a 2-dose COVID-19 vaccine series, or a two week period after receiving a single-dose (or any government recommended booster shot) in a single dose COVID-19 vaccine.

Who We Are:  Originally founded in the 1970s, Infotech® Consulting pioneered the use of sophisticated statistical and econometric techniques for detecting fraudulent business behavior. Today, Infotech Consulting remains committed to using data to uncover the truth. Our data management and expert analysis have been used for many high-profile national and international price-fixing, collusion and bid-rigging cases, resulting in the recovery of billions of dollars to injured consumers, governments and other private parties. Infotech has grown into a multi-divisional organization that also develops software products used in the road and highway infrastructure industry. For the second year in a row, Infotech was ranked #21 among Florida Trend’s “Best Companies to Work For” in the large company category and #9 among companies headquartered in Florida! What We Are Looking For Infotech is seeking highly experienced  Data Analysts  to work alongside a world-class team of researchers, data experts, and expert witnesses. These positions offer a unique combination of both data management work and hands-on analysis responsibilities. Depending on your background, skills, and interest you will join one of the following teams: Data Management or Data Analysis. Data Management:   Through collaboration with our Case Development and Data Analysis teams, you will collect, review, and standardize client data. In addition, you will play a critical role in processing data and performing quality checks to ensure data integrity. As a member of the Data Management team, your typical duties may include:  Acquiring data from native sources to perform quality checks and evaluate and standardize. Performing preliminary analysis of data to ensure relevance, including preliminary modelling and removing bad or irrelevant data. Processing data from large datasets through advanced use of tools such as SAS and Stata. Summarizing findings and generating questions to aid in the production of reports. Collaborating closely with the Case Development and Data Analysis departments to obtain clarifying information about the data. Data Analysis:   As a key member of the Data Analysis team, you will analyze and summarize large, complex datasets. With direct access to our team of experts, your work directly impacts the quality and reliability of our services. As a member of the Data Analysis team, your typical duties may include:  Performing complex statistical, economic, and econometric analysis. Summarizing complex data and presenting data clearly and concisely in reports and for expert testifiers. Applying statistical and economic modeling to clarify and explain pertinent issues. Supporting Testifying Experts to confidently communicate complex ideas in simple ways. Collaborating closely with the Case Development and Data Management departments to ensure all relevant data has been collected, reviewed, standardized, analyzed, and summarized. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, economics, mathematics, decision information systems or related field and 4 years relevant experience; or Master’s Degree in related field and 2 years relevant experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Preferred Qualifications 6-8 years’ experience in data management or data analysis. Masters or PhD in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, or Big Data Analytics. Litigation support experience is a plus, but not required. Data analytics experience in areas such as, but not limited to, antitrust, class action, breach of contract, labor disputes, and healthcare fraud. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Technical Skills Extensive experience with statistical and econometric software (e.g., SAS, Stata, R). Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel. Collaboration and communication tools we typically use: Gmail, Microsoft OneDrive, Google Drive, Slack, WebEx, and Zoom. Location Infotech Consulting is headquartered in our state of the art facility in beautiful Gainesville, Florida. Its temperate climate and abundant ecotourism areas make Gainesville a nature-lover’s paradise. It is also home to the highly ranked University of Florida which contributes to the diverse and ever evolving nightlife and cultural activities available in Gainesville. This position is open to fully remote candidates, however preference may be given to candidates able to commit to a flexible remote work arrangement that requires a consistent presence working from our Gainesville headquarters. Hiring Timeline and Application Instructions Infotech anticipates the need to hire several Econometric and Statistical Data Analysts over the next year. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis based on staffing needs.  Resume and cover letter are required . Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c) Job Type: Full-time

Senior AI/ML Software Developer Lexmark creates innovative imaging solutions and technologies that help customers worldwide print, secure, and manage information with ease, efficiency and unmatched value. Combining innovative technologies with deep industry expertise, Lexmark simplifies the complex intersection of digital and printed information in retail, financial services, healthcare, manufacturing, education, government and more. Lexmark operates in over 170 countries. The Lexmark Ventures division is chartered with leveraging Lexmark technologies, competencies, and relationships to establish non-traditional Lexmark growth, revenues, and contribution. The Senior AI/ML Software Developer will develop advanced AI, neural network, machine learning, data analytics, and optimization algorithms and apply them to create new intelligent devices, solutions and services, with prominent emphasis on vision-based problems. Fluent in convolutional neural network architectures and toolkits. Capable of building novel neural networks or using existing networks and optimizing to meet customer demands. Proficient in python and C++ development, and experienced building Vision Based AI applications (object detection, classification, tracking, segmentation, etc). Creates and maintains complex datasets and tools for annotating and training new AI models. Conversant in training of neural networks for temporal based problems (detecting human behaviors, etc). Builds AI applications for deployment on embedded systems or in the cloud, depending on customer need. About Crypto.com  Founded in 2016, Crypto.com today serves over 10 million customers with the world’s fastest growing crypto app, along with the Crypto.com Visa Card — the world’s largest crypto card program — the Crypto.com Exchange and Crypto.com DeFi Wallet. Recently launched, Crypto.com NFT is the premier platform for collecting and trading NFTs, carefully curated from the worlds of art, design, entertainment and sports. Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO/IEC 27701:2019, CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and independently assessed at Tier 4, the highest level for both NIST Cybersecurity and Privacy Frameworks. With over 3,000 people in offices across the Americas, Europe and Asia, Crypto.com is accelerating the world’s transition to cryptocurrency. Find out more: https://crypto.com   Description  Crypto.com is seeking an experienced Data Architect to join our high-performing and agile team. This role will facilitate the collection, extract, transform, loading and using data within an organization, and provide comprehensive data for supporting the 7x24 security monitoring team for security analysis and triage, as well as facilitating incident response & giving input to internal & external threat intelligence in the Cyber Fusion Center. Responsibilities  Serve as a Subject Matter Expert of data principles (data analysis, modeling, ETL/ELT, storage and delivery)  Design, build, maintain and support batch and stream data processing pipelines  Collect data from various internal sources and SaaS platforms  Maintain the security related data in a data warehouse / data lake that aggregates data from different sources into a single, central, consistent data store to support data analysis, data mining, artificial intelligence (AI), and machine learning  Manage data and log platforms like Splunk, Elastic Stacks, Sumo Logic, etc.  Acquiring the requirements from the monitoring team and threat intelligence team and take charge of the data extraction, enrichment and transformation Archive & retain data in accordance with the compliance requirements  Assist in data mining project to facilitate anomaly detection and UEBA in large datasets  Visualizing data for security posture and security intelligence  Requirements  3+ years of experience with developing highly responsive data structures, metadata capture strategies, ontologies, and data dictionaries  2+ years of experience with managing classified data as well as sensitive data  2+ years of experience with developing architecture, policies, extract-transform-load (ETL) data pipelines, and data model  Experience in using various ETL tools like Logstash, Elasticsearch, Splunk, Tableau, etc.  Experience in using cloud native data processing tools like AWS S3, Athena, Glue, Redshift, Azure Data Factory, Blob, etc.  Experience in one of the scripting languages - Python, Ruby, Bash or similar.  Experience developing, maintaining and supporting production grade distributed data processing applications on Cloud Native Stacks like AWS or Azure is a big plus.  Benefits  We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of combining cryptocurrency and financial services.  Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you.  You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team.  Flexible working.

Job Description The  Senior Algorithm/AI Engineering Manager  will provide direct and indirect leadership to Algorithm/AI Engineers across the Elbit America Engineering team, so that products and/or services are delivered in response to customer needs. The Manager will provide mentorship and leadership to the team while carrying out the strategic plan by meeting business goals & objectives. This role will be responsible for developing and growing the skills and tools of our Algorithm/AI Engineering team. The Algorithm/AI Engineering team spans across multiple ESA locations and the Senior Manager will manage this geographically diverse organization. This Senior Manager will have responsibility for staffing, hiring, and skill development of the project engineering team, working with peers across ESA engineering to successfully execute programs. Responsibilities The Senior Manager of Algorithm/AI Engineering will be both a contributing member and a lead of the Algorithm/AI Engineering organization. They will be responsible for assessing current and upcoming program needs for Algorithm/AI Engineering and acting to staff programs with qualified resources, including internal or external resources as appropriate. Provide support to Project Engineer Managers as necessary, to include, but not limited to development of program planning strategies, proposals, technical cost estimates, evaluation of alternatives, risk management, logistics management, cost-performance trade-offs, preparation of data, status updates and presentations at customer reviews. Works with project engineer(s) to develop solutions to customer requirements and facilitates resolutions where product line conflicts arise. Supports engineering program reviews as a non-advocate reviewer to help drive improved engineering performance Supports the development of and adherence to company engineering design processes. This should include training and development of existing workforce, hiring of additional resources, working with peers across the organization to leverage other resources within ESA, and working with appropriate 3rd party organizations when necessary to augment ESA staff. job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Natural Language Processing / NLP
job_Description: Our client helps organizations globally to build trust and speed into their business by matching the Speed of PrivacyOps to the Speed of Dev/BusinessOps. Clients include Patreon, Twilio, Coinbase, Robinhood, and Samara. Design and implement end-to-end Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing models and systems to help construct the foundation on which our global data infrastructure will be built.  Role Overview This role requires you to design and implement end-to-end Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) models and systems to drive business impact. You partner with cross-functional stakeholders and customers to frame business problems as ML problems, prototype solutions effectively, and implement production-grade ML systems and the backend software systems they support to provide end to end five-star user experiences. Given you are constructing the foundation on which our global data infrastructure will be built, you need to pay close attention to detail and maintain a forward-thinking outlook as well as scrappiness for the present needs. You thrive in a fast-paced, iterative, but heavily test-driven development environment, with full ownership to design features from scratch to impact the business and the accountability that comes along. Responsibilities Scoping: Actively participate in customer engagements and partner with cross-functional stakeholders (legal product managers, customer success) to scope technical requirements for high impact business problems; determine whether ML is the right tool for the job and, if it is, how to frame the problem as an ML task Prototyping: Investigate different options quickly and thoroughly to identify the simplest, most pragmatic tool that drives business impact End-to-end System Design and Implementation: Gather training data; train, deploy, evaluate, and iteratively improve production-grade machine learning systems; implement and test the backend software systems they support to provide end-to-end five-star user experiences Follow and promote software engineering and machine learning best practices across the organization; keep up to date with the state of the art developments in NLP research, open-source frameworks, and MLOps Shape the direction of machine learning and build a cohesive team culture of ownership, growth, transparency, and customer focus You are a good fit if you: Have a track record of delivering production-grade ML/NLP models and systems, specifically in text classification, entity and relation extraction, summarization, question-answering, and knowledge base construction (2+ years) Have strong software engineering skills, and set examples by writing modular and maintainable code considering design principles and applying sound testing practices Are comfortable with Python, and have experience with ML/NLP tools and libraries such as scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, spaCy, Hugging Face, Gensim, etc. Have a systematic and goal-directed approach to project management Are comfortable dealing with ambiguity and ruthlessly prioritizing and managing your time with a sense of urgency Thrive in a self-directed environment with full ownership to design features from scratch to impact the business and the accountability that comes along Are proactive about continuous improvement and excited about learning at breakneck speed in a fast-growth environment; are eager to candidly and directly give and receive feedback to improve together as a team Are customer and mission-driven, motivated by bringing the most value as possible to users and shaping an industry from the ground up Are the ultimate team player: collaborate effectively with others, consistently make time to help your teammates, and are ego-less in the search for the best ideas

Company Description A science-first software company, nference has been called “The Google of Biomedicine” by the Washington Post. Our proprietary AI-enabled software is the only platform that addresses the end-to-end challenges associated with unlocking the potential of electronic medical records (EMRs) in a privacy-preserving manner. The exponential growth of biomedical data, driven by the adoption of EMRs, provides an unprecedented opportunity to create transformative technologies and products in healthcare. nference partners with medical centers to turn decades of rich, but predominantly unstructured, data captured in EMRs into powerful solutions that enable scientists to discover and develop the next generation of personalized diagnostics and treatments for patients worldwide. We believe that the greatest opportunity for our generation to elevate human health is by developing technology to curate and synthesize the world's biomedical data in order to enable that scientific discovery. nference is headquartered in Kendall Square (Cambridge, MA), the world’s biotech capital, with offices in Rochester (Minnesota), Bangalore (India) and Toronto (Canada). You will work alongside a multidisciplinary team of serial entrepreneurs from the tech and biotech worlds along with highly trained, innovative and dedicated scientists/physicians (PhD in Biology/Genomics and/or MD). Job Description nference is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Scientist/Visualization Engineers. This position would be focused on execution of the various scientific collaborations with our partners and developing innovative components that can be incorporated into our analytics platform that is used to gain insights from the entire gamut of medical data(clinical notes in natural language text, longitudinal structured patient history, images and videography, lab and clinical measurements and observations, genomics etc.). In this position, you would work closely with physicians, scientists, data scientists, and engineers, both internally and externally, to drive forward cutting-edge research and develop new models of patient care. You must be a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment – which requires wearing many hats, the ability to change direction quickly, and an eagerness to learn new technologies as needed. This position will be based in our Durham, NC office. Individuals do not have to be physically located in Durham and can be remote. Responsibilities :  - Exploring, examining and presenting data from multiple structured and unstructured sources with the goal of discovering advancing hypotheses relevant to life sciences and biomedicine - Applying mathematical and statistical concepts to perform analyses across a diverse range of scientific, clinical and translational datasets. - Leveraging expertise in computer science, software development and algorithms to analyze and implement analytic workflow processes and data visualizations. - Deploy, debug and ensure high performance of developed solutions. - Working with a team of other data scientists to build and develop the core software platform and underlying inference tools. Working with research scientists and clinical scientists in leveraging those tools towards collaborations with physicians and biopharma researchers. - Leveraging speaking skills and presentation expertise to convey complex information to audiences from diverse backgrounds Required Qualifications :  - BS/MS in computer science, data science, computer engineering, statistics - Ability to build visualizations of analytic information using web technologies - Understanding of data structures, software engineering principles, software architecture and machine learning principles - Coding experience: Web technologies like Javascript/HTML/CSS, Web frameworks like React/Angular, NoSQL and SQL databases. Familiarity with languages like python, golang, C/C++ and machine learning tools like pandas, NumPy, scipy, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, Jupyter notebooks etc. will be additionally preferred. - Experience with software development · Working with big data · Data quality analysis · Feature engineering · Model training, testing, and validation using packages - Familiarity with statistical analysis and database queries - Must be able to work collaboratively, must be able to work across teams - Experience working with healthcare (electronic health records, claims data, etc.) or biological datasets (RNAseq, genomics, proteomics, etc.) strongly preferred Position includes competitive sick/vacation/holiday package, equity, health, dental, life insurance, STD, LTD and 401k plan. nference will only respond via email to candidates selected for further consideration. nference is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity, gender expression, sex/gender, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Work Location: Multiple Locations

Our tradition of delivering innovative, technical solutions dates back to 1995, however, you may know us better by one of our legacy company names: Trident Technologies, Smartronix, Datastrong or C2S Consulting Group. With the support of OceanSound Partners, our private equity investment sponsor, we began operating as one business starting in 2019 and became SMX in 2021. We operate in close proximity to our clients around the globe and have core locations in Alabama, California, DC Metro, Florida, Hawaii, Maryland, and Massachusetts.  Today, as SMX, we are one team and together empower government and commercial enterprises to become more effective, innovative, and resilient, no matter what challenges they face. Smartronix is seeking an inquisitive and adaptable Senior Data Analyst, with a Department of Defense secret security clearance, to  join our team in sunny Key West!  As a Smartronix Data Analyst, you will quickly learn and understand the United States Southern Command (SOUTHCOM) operational and business needs, as well as data across multiple subordinate commands and systems. The ideal candidate will operate in a highly collaborative environment and will effectively work and communicate within SOUTHCOM, JIATF-S and as well as the user community, to understand the mission and operating systems. The Data Analyst will use data from multiple projects and sources to determine the Return on Investment (ROI) of such programs, which will be reported up to command leadership. The ideal candidate will understand how to develop and modify dashboards based on provided requirements to achieve desired results.  The best candidate for this position will be capable of decisive action and grounded in a strong analytical and creative approach to mastering challenges.    Essential Duties & Responsibilities   Review raw data contained in operational logs and identify relevant data elements to be extracted to inform on Return on Investment(ROI)  Review historical JOC logs to extract and populate the CN Database built by Praevius  Return on Investment (ROI) analysis and reporting  Conduct Quality control checks of JOC information that gets loaded into the CN Database  Develop an enduring cost-tracking methodology, accepted widely across the enterprise, to inform the investment tracking of the Return-on-Investment framework  Assist in the development of requirements enabling wider acceptance and deeper utility of the CN ROI dashboard  Develop and maintain a library of reports/ dashboards/ scorecards and prepare reports, tables, graphs  Identify and make recommendations on trends in data discrepancies and executes steps to reconcile data  Oversee the training of JOC personnel and implementation of process improvements within the JOC to improve the accuracy and efficiency of CN Database inputs  Establish credibility and foster cooperation between the HQ and JIATFS   Knowledge, Skills & Abilities   Required Clearance: Secret  Ability to obtain TS clearance  Must be comfortable working in a dynamic environment with several ongoing concurrent projects; able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively  Process-oriented with the ability to understand and reengineer existing business processes and recommend new processes and procedures  Strong analytical and financial capabilities  Advanced Excel skills and experience in cost analysis  Strong testing skills with a high attention to detail for accuracy  Ability to develop dashboards and train personnel on dashboard development  Experience developing Return on Investment reports based on reviewing raw data and cost  Working knowledge of database design and data engineering fundamentals  Experience developing and implementing operating and business processes and procedures     Education & Experience   5+ years of experience in processing large volumes and variety of data (Structured and unstructured data, writing code for parallel processing)  Bachelor's in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance (or equivalent degree) required   Vaccination within 60-days of hire, or an approved accommodation, is a requirement of the position per Executive Order 14042 (unless precluded by State law). If a candidate is not vaccinated, they may request an accommodation once offered the position, and the accommodation must be granted prior to the employee starting in the position. Candidate will have 60 days to get vaccinated.  #cjpost #LI-DD1 SMX is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability status, protected veteran status, race, color, age, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or genetic information. Selected applicant will be subject to a background investigation. SMX is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.
