Job Description: Role Overview: The Analytics and Workflow Data Scientist will assess current state correspondence data repositories and analyze opportunities for improvement in both content and delivery. The function will provide transparency from correspondence, by presenting advanced analytics on opportunities and benefits in the areas of client behavior and experience, cost efficiency, operational efficiency, and capacity forecasting. The role will report to the Document Solutions Analytics and Workflow executive in the Consumer Small Business and Wealth Management Operations organization. Key Responsibilities: Partner with technology to create and maintain a suite of data science tools in order to utilize advanced analytics methodologies like Natural Language Processing, text and sentiment analysis, and basic statistical modeling methods Take advantage of the client correspondence data set and make meaningful insights on correspondence strategy Understand cost basis around different demographics Determine, develop, and maintain appropriate workflow allocation strategies Develop automation strategies, including identification of automation opportunities and ability to build automation systems Collaboration and coordination with our CSWO Capacity Planning & Forecasting team to help identify,  develop and maintain appropriate models for operational capacity planning, including both person and system capacity Role Qualifications: Experience leading: Reporting and analytical efforts to deepen understanding of business economics, client experience, etc. Design, development, execution and continuous improvement of LOB reporting and dashboards Solutions that drive efficiencies, improve reliability and reduce costs Ability to bring multiple stakeholders together, cut to the heart of issues to reach consensus & decisions, demonstrate personal courage. Leadership Competencies: Strong relationship management skills to navigate the complexities of gaining buy-in, building consensus and resolving conflicts in a large, distributed organization Ability to decompose complex issues and drive timely decisions, knowing when to engage others for additional input, and when to act  independently Key Stakeholders: CSWO SLT Consumer and GWIM Product leaders Legal Risk Audit Finance Required Skills: Expert in data management programming such as SQL, PL-SQL, and Python as well as being familiar win the workings of motion-tracking data and time-series analyses 3+ years experience implementing data science platforms like IBM Watson suite of products, Anaconda Enterprise, Dataiku, Domino Labs, C3 AI Suite etc. Experience working with big data and eco system (e.g. Hadoop, Hive, Spark, HBase, Sqoop, Impala, Kafka, Flume, Oozie, MapReduce, S3 etc.) Experience with machine learning frameworks (like Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, CoreNLP, Gensim) Extensive experience designing and implementing complex solutions Experienced leader with excellent communication skills Highly skilled in statistical and modeling packages such as SAS, Statistica, Matlab, R, visualization and other advanced analysis tools Vast experience and expertise with probability and statistics, inclusive of machine learning, experimental design, and optimization Desired Skills: Experience developing software in C, C++, Java, Scala, Ruby, and/or Python Minimum 2+ years of experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Linguistics, Advanced Semantic Design Enterprise Role Overview: Responsible for enabling analysis, modeling, and optimization through producing information products. Actively involved in the research and development efforts. Primary requirement is not related to traditional programming or systems analysis skills but to the ability to create sophisticated, value-added analytic systems that support revenue generation, risk management, operational efficiency, regulatory compliance, portfolio management, and research. These systems must overcome issues of complex data (e.g., VLDB, multi-structured, big data, etc.) as well as deployment of advanced techniques (e.g., machine learning, text mining, statistical analysis, etc.) to deliver insights. Responsible for adoption of enterprise information products through clearly communicating how enterprise information products answer material banking questions leading to decisions and actions. This role often possesses an advanced degree in hard science or another heavy quantitative business or social discipline. Able to lead or work independently on complex projects and influence strategic direction. Job Band: H4 Shift: 1st shift (United States of America) Hours Per Week: 40 Weekly Schedule: Referral Bonus Amount: 0

(Senior) Data Scientist, DHL Consulting DHL Consulting is the international management and supply chain consultancy of Deutsche Post DHL Group. We empower the top management of Deutsche Post DHL Group (DPDHL Group) and its customers to shape the future of their businesses – worldwide. With an ambitious and highly motivated team in four locations globally, we develop high-impact solutions for the business and supply chain challenges of today and tomorrow.  As aData Scientist at DHL Consulting, you will work in a unique setup with our Consultants to solve concrete business problems. Being part of a global team, you will work collaboratively to apply methods such as time series analysis, operations research methods, and machine learning algorithms (e.g. trees, neural networks) to answer a wide range of business problems. Analytics-related problems may relate to the DPDHL Group, its customers, or DHL Consulting's own business. Examples of these include but are not limited to, developing machine learning tools for route optimization and freight rates' prediction, sales analytics, demand forecasting for inventory optimization. Specifically, you will work on analytical frameworks for data analytics projects based on an understanding of concrete business requirements and operational processes. You will conduct data analyses, develop mathematical models, build dashboards, and create prototypes. You look into data for patterns to “let the data speak.” You will learn how to interpret modelling results in a business context and discuss these with your business stakeholders. You will sharpen your data skills by running quick analyses and present your outcomes to consultants and clients. To further incorporate data-driven decision-making in operations, you will consolidate the methodological skills and knowledge acquired from completed projects. Be part of a group that is making a shift towards automation and data – “Build tomorrow”! You will also use your expertise to support project acquisition by identifying new strategic application areas, use cases or products by applying innovative data analytics methods and technologies. We offer: Variety of exciting projects in logistics and across all organizational, functional areas of the DPDHL Group Very unique set up that combines data and consulting Lean structure, regular interaction with Senior Management Great freedom in learning, working and personal development within an atmosphere where every idea is heard A mentor who is individually assigned to you Specific training designed around your unique potential Collaboration opportunities with diverse clients and colleagues in our four offices globally Participation in international data conferences (e.g. Strata Conference) Highly collaborative team built on mutual respect and support Modern, open, creative and flexible office design Mobile office concept that caters for your flexible work mode International career opportunities: Work for a certain time in one of our satellite offices in Cologne (Germany), Singapore or Shanghai You would like to learn more about Data Sciences with the DPDHL Group? Please follow this link:DPDHL Data Sciences  University degree ideally in Statistics, alternatively Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or related natural sciences / technical degree, or comparable qualification At least 2-3 years of relevant professional experience in statistical modelling and machine learning Experience in analyzing complex datasets and building mathematical predictive and prescriptive models, also in a practical business context Experience in leading and driving data science projects Instinctive and natural affinity towards agile working methods Ability to let the data speak, but also to massage data for serving a use-case Strong programming skills in the following languages: Python with e.g., Pandas, Numpy, and other usual packages Experience in at least one visualization tool like Tableau or PowerBI, understanding of visualizations such as Sankey Experience in working with databases Business acumen: Ability to produce outstandingly creative and analytical solutions based on clear and thorough analyses of complex processes and business relationships Drive, motivation, and curiosity: Learn new topics from business and data, find out what is the real underlying problem and how data can support, but also follow trends in data science Excellent written and spoken English Comfortable explaining complex analytical and technical content to various audiences Independent work ethic, with integrity, loyalty and a positive “can-do”- attitude Passionate team player Submit your application in English including your CV, cover letter, and academic records. Email us if you have any questions. We’d be happy to hear from you:DHLConsulting-US@dhl.com

Job Description:  * Purpose/Duties: * Assists in developing and executing data driven research supporting the business and member needs of Achieva. Delivers analytic projects and leads the long term development of machine learning models and applications. Supports the design, testing, and implementation of solutions for consumer pricing, segmentation, customer relationship management, and market analytics. Designs and implements new insights and workflows for data science and analytics that has wide relevance supporting both improved business decisions and operational productivity. Key Result Areas:  Assists in the design of rich data visualizations to communicate complex ideas to branch managers, staff, and credit union leadership.  Time: 25% Performs advanced modeling and analysis of customer, member transaction, and campaign data to identify trends and patterns to shape consumer segmentation and identify consumer behavior.  Time: 20% Supports the collection, analysis, and interpretation of information from multiple data sources helping to identify insights that create efficiencies, identify consumer perspectives on financial products, or generate revenue._ Time: 20%_ Assists in the application of analytical models and data mining techniques with large and varied data sets.  Time: 15% Helps to build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms from development through testing for both operational environments and consumer focused decision making._ Time: 15%_ Manages other efforts and staff in data collection, distribution, and analysis including the support of ETL processes to CRM cloud platforms like Salesforce._ Time: 5%_ Required Experience:  * Required Education: * Bachelor's Degree in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, economics, operations engineering, or other related field with appropriate advanced classes in econometrics, statistics, programming, applied mathematics, or previous work with consumer segmentation, propensity modelling, customer lifetime value, CRM analytics, or predictive pricing. Preferred: Master's Degree in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, economics, operations engineering, or other related field. Required Experience:  3 to 5 years of experience in diverse statistical and data mining techniques experience with a mix of at least some of the following methods: regression, random forest, clustering, text mining, social media analysis, etc. Preferred: 5 or more years of experience in diverse statistical and data mining techniques experience with a mix of at least some of the following methods: regression, random forest, clustering, text mining, social media analysis, etc. Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  Basic to intermediate skill set with at least one statistical package in either STATA, SPSS, MATLAB, GAUSS, etc. Intermediate to advanced knowledge of data management languages and technologies such as SQL, NoSQL, or Hadoop. Ability to program in at least two of the following Python, C++, R, Spark, Scala, etc. Intermediate to advanced experience in data visualization platforms such as Tableau or Power BI. Exceptional written and listening skills From: Achieva Credit Union Job Type: Full-time

When you join Verizon  Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here. What you’ll be doing...  This role is part of our Network Enablement team within Verizon's Artificial Intelligence and Data (AI&D)center of excellence and is responsible for program and project coordination and support across multiple groups within Global Network and Technology (GN&T). We are tasked with bringing innovative AI/ML solutions to the business units that allow them to enable efficiencies. The Artificial Intelligence and Data (AI&D) organization focuses on delivering the power of data and AI to drive our marketplace leadership through innovative solutions that create value for our customers, shareholders, V Teamers, and society; responsibly. You'll use your analytics expertise to enhance our customer experience by ensuring best-in-class network quality, increasing efficiency, and predicting and preventing network issues. You'llpartner with the business to understand problems and develop actionable insights and solutions to solve them. Most projects start with descriptive analytics to rapidly answer and visualize the who, what, when, where, why, and how types of questions. You’ll then move into deeper statistical analysis and visualization. Our work is less about research and development, and more about solving actual business problems with data science methodologies All of our work is worked cross-functionally, hand in hand with the business partners, domain experts, partner teams, and each piece is well documented along the way. Regular reviews of use cases occur with leadership, which requires using data to tell the story of importance, priority, value, and benefit. Partnering with others across the business to build proof of concepts, prototypes, machine learning models, and new approaches for analyzing network and consumer behavior. Designing experiments to confirm our assumptions, answer our questions, and drive business change. Designing creative approaches using data analytic and AI/ML techniques to uncover the most valuable opportunities for cost and time-savings. Consulting and communicating with cross-functional stakeholders and senior leaders on insights, trends, and data-driven recommendations and solutions. Partnering with our AI&D peers to develop and deploy business-relevant insights and solutions. Finding ways to improve customer experience by developing statistical models, utilities, and code. In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager. What we’re looking for...  You’re a steadfast, creative thinker who likes to explore, and uncover the issues. You are great at influencing up, down, and across groups, and you take satisfaction in mentoring others. Communicating a compelling story of what you’ve uncovered in a way that can be easily understood by others is one of your strengths. You are detail-oriented and know how to focus on what really matters. You are a self-starter and a multitasker who can work independently under tight timelines. You want to make an impact by providing the data that will help improve the experience of our customers. You’ll need to have: Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience. Four or more years of relevant work experience. Experience analyzing and validating large data sets. Experience with applied statistics. Experience developing visually compelling and interactive dashboards. Experience with Tableau or similar visual analysis tools. Experience with SQL and Python. Willingnes to travel. Even better if you have: A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Business Analytics, or a related field. Experience in VBG, VCG, or Network Operations. Experience with Alteryx. Experience with Google Cloud Platform. Experience developing machine learning models. Equal Employment Opportunity  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our  diversity and inclusion  page to learn more.  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement Verizon requires new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Verizon provides reasonable accommodations consistent with legal requirements (e.g., for medical or religious reasons).

The data scientist is accountable to facilitate innovation of new J&J Vision Care products through commercialization. The business process workflows and insights that data scientists deliver and uncover enable new product teams to drive business decisions, take actions intended to improve decisions, accelerate product development and achieve business goals.  The data scientist contributes, facilitates and improves execution of new product development projects. The data scientist can leverage existing knowledge, find and choose optimal data sources and data features, and create new ones as needed in order to extract meaningful information and actionable insights. This position routinely facilitates execution of new product development projects using data engineering, visualization and analytics expertise. This position also demonstrates advanced understanding of data systems and reporting techniques and effectively partners with IT on data accessibility needs, while working closely with NPI and business domain experts to effectively communicate and interpret data while utilizing any and all relevant statistical techniques, programming languages, software packages and libraries, and data infrastructure. The data scientist also contributes high quality and timely deliverables as assessed by stakeholders and NPI management  The data scientist facilitates innovation activities on pilot and pre-launch scale prototyping and manufacturing platforms using standard performance metrics, dashboards, and models to develop appropriate specifications that define new products, materials and processes. The data scientist incorporates function mapping, Quality Function Deployment (QFD), Quality by Design, and statistical techniques to achieve business goals. In addition, the data scientist presents oral and written reports to communicate progress and insights as well as assists in development and delivery of technical and management training on QFD, relevant statistical techniques, programming languages, software packages and libraries, and data infrastructure.  The data scientist develops strong partnerships with the NPI teams and works closely with R&D NPI Leads and Product Platform project managers to effectively use data to facilitate execution of New Product Introduction strategies.  The data scientist works to bridge R&D data processes to clinical data in conjunction with the clinical biostatistics team. The person in this role develops best practices for data architecture, data management, and analytics in support of data pipeline development tying in NPI and Clinical data. The data scientist may assist with clinical studies and research where appropriate and works with clinical sciences on data research involving historical data, meta analyses, benchmarking, and machine learning methodologies. This role adheres to safety and environmental policies and procedures, and supports other department objectives and engages in Credo-based decision-making.  Responsibilities:  Support experimental strategies, data engineering and analytics to facilitate product, process, and material characterization during development of new products. Partner with project teams using function mapping and QFD.  Produce clear, concise well designed computer applications to capture, access, and report NPI data. Use commercial software packages and develop custom software tailored to the specific needs of the department.  Provide leadership and act as a technical consultant for the department. Provide coaching, training, and development of department personnel.  Participate in troubleshooting and resolving product and process problems. Oversee routine maintenance of custom software programs. Perform other related duties as assigned by management.   Qualifications Qualifications:  Bachelors, Master’s or PhD Degree plus equivalent experience in a relevant technical field (Math, Statistics or Data Science preferred)  A minimum of 7+ years experience with BS degree. A minimum of 5+ years with MS degree.  A minimum of 3+ years with PhD. Strong computer programming skills with experience in a variety of software languages and applications. SAS and SQL knowledge is required. Additional knowledge of SAS Enterprise Guide, Stored Processes, and some Python/R is preferred. Experence building enterprise software applications used for NPI business workflow automation. Strong Statistical Techniques including Statistical Quality Control (SPC), Design of Experiments, Acceptance Sampling, Probability, Data Visualization, Modeling and Simulation, and predictive analytics.  Excellent written and oral communication skills required.  Excellent organizational skills required.   Primary Location United States-Florida-Jacksonville-7500 Centurion Parkway  Organization Johnson & Johnson Vision Care, Inc. (6094)  Job Function R&D  Requisition ID 2206006497W

Homesite Insurance was founded in 1997 and was one of the first companies to enable customers to purchase home insurance directly online, during a single visit. Since then, we've continued to innovate rapidly to meet the needs of our customers and their changing expectations. One thing that's stayed the same since our founding: our commitment to our customers, partners and employees. Join us on our journey as we continue to grow into a powerful contender in the field of insurance. Compensation may vary based on the job level and your geographic work location. Compensation Minimum:$63,000 Compensation Maximum:$130,000 Homesite is an innovative national property and casualty insurance company with a fast-paced environment. We're proud to be part of the American Family Mutual Insurance Company and offer multiple products in partnership with large national brands. We seek a person possessing analytical rigor, a sense of data and mad coding skills with a desire to build a successful career in Data Science. The primary role will be to grow profits through the development of state of the art pricing and product plans. Additional responsibilities include: Lead predictive modeling projects involving new rating structures, recommenders and underwriting programs that increase our customer lifetime value. Use statistical and machine learning/deep learning to build supervised, semi-supervised and unsupervised models per business needs. Work with fellow data scientists and developer teams to translate models to business solutions and collaborate with other departments in the company when necessary. Work with IT to help implement the models in production. Interface with stakeholders to communicate the value add of the models being built. Requirements: Master’s degree or higher in Statistics, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics or other quantitative discipline. Solid understanding of Machine Learning and Statistical methods. Ability to extract and clean data from a variety of structured and unstructured sources. Solid understanding of best practices in coding, code organization, data transformation, imputation, model selection, evaluation, and tuning. Prior experience with GLMs and Bayesian modeling is a plus. Experience with AWS (SageMaker) and exposure to deep learning is preferred. Proficiency in programming in Python, R and SQL. Knowledge of Go, Java or Scala is a plus. Knowledge of one version control system, preferably Git is required. Mastery of the command line is good to have. Prior experience with H2O and DataRobot is a plus. When you work at Homesite you can expect benefits that support your physical, emotional, and financial wellbeing. You will have access to comprehensive medical, dental, vision and wellbeing benefits that enable you to take care of your health. We also offer a competitive 401(k) contribution, a pension plan, an annual incentive, and a paid-time off program. In addition, our student loan repayment program and paid-family leave are available to support our employees and their families. Interns at Homesite are eligible for the paid time off program. Contingent workers are not eligible for American Family Enterprise benefits. Stay connected: Join Our Enterprise Talent Community!
